nodes.text: Okay, it's now or never. I have to break into Gerhard's office and find the Raven... or I go back to the streets and miss the last day of class. Right.
O'Conner - we need to talk right now. I want my map back.
I trusted you! You know how important that map is to me! Give it back right now.

options.text: Calm Katie down by being Polite

nodes.text: Your map is missing? No wonder you're so upset. It's okay, we'll get it back.
Don't try to act so innocent! I know that you stole it.
Relax, calm down. There's no need to be -
Don't tell me calm down after you stole my map! I want it back now!
Katie, I didn't steal your map.
Repeat after me, "Shawn did not steal your map." You'll feel much better when you do that.
I talked to you about the map last night and today my map is gone from my pack. That makes you the chief suspect.
Don't look at me like that - I didn't take your stupid map.
I'll look at you anyway I want to - you thief! I want my map!

options.text: Say Something Clever to Show You Want to Help

nodes.text: Okay, so what you are telling me is that your map is missing and you think I'm to blame. Is that why you're angry with me?
Of course I'm angry - you stole it. No one else but Esme knew about the map.
Katie, I know how much that map means to you. You have every reason to be angry.
You're my friend. I certainly wouldn't want to hurt you by stealing your map.
When did you notice that the map was missing?
Just a few minutes ago, when I was putting my notebook away in my pack in the classroom. The map was gone, but I just put it there this morning!
So the map must have been stolen either at breakfast or in class, is that it?
Aye, that's so. I want it back, O'Conner.
In the Dining Hall, you left your pack in the corner with everyone else's backpacks, right?
... yes, that's so.
So anyone could have taken the map from your pack during breakfast, couldn't they?
No one else knew of the map but you and Esme. And I trust Esme!

options.text: Say Something Polite to Remind Katie of Your Friendship

nodes.text: I thought you liked me!
I don't like liars and thieves.
Oh, then you do like me!
Katie, we're friends. You can trust me. I really didn't steal the map. We need to find the real thief.
Of course a thief would say that.

options.text: Say Something Clever to Help Katie Consider Other Suspects

nodes.text: You talked to me yesterday in the Dining Hall right after supper. I didn't notice anyone around at the time, but we're Rogues, right? We study the art of eavesdropping.
Anyone could have been listening into our conversation.
And we both know two people from our class who are more likely than I am to have stolen your map, don't we?
Maybe...

options.text: Say Something Snarky to Convince Katie to Look Elsewhere

nodes.text: Since Esme didn't steal your map, and I didn't steal your map, we need to focus on who else would have taken it.
Now who has the skill to overhear conversations, hide in shadows, and has a shadier reputation than I have? Hmmm...
I have a couple of likely suspects in mind who are not your friends.
Yeah, well, I've got one in mind that I thought was my friend.
Don't worry, I'll help you get your map back.
Besides, you probably have it memorized by now from all that studying you've done. Even without the map, you will find that treasure.
Okay, maybe you didn't steal the map. I'm still upset about it.
But I will find that treasure - with the map or without it.
And any help you give me will be appreciated.
